author: sebcp
title: Three.js for 3D-Webaverse games
description: Game development for Cardano based 3D-games and web-apps is currently inconvenient, as both topics are yet entirely separated.

f6_assessments.q0: The project effectively addresses the challenge. React is a popular frontend framework and building any tooling to make connecting wallets easier will add value to the Cardano gaming space. I am not giving 5 starts because very little information is provided on how the component library that is proposed will actually connect to wallets. For example, will they build it so that browser based or application based wallets can connect? I would recommend the proposer share any successes they may have already had in regards with wallet to application connections. Perhaps communicate to the voter how their is a lack of tooling in this regard, and how your build will fill a much needed void. Remember you voter will not know everything about Cardano and application development, so provide as much convincing information as you can.
f6_assessments.q1: Cannot assess this category highly. Very little detail is provided in regards to the qualifications and experience of the team members, their roles, how many there are, how the funds will be used, or a timeline for development. I would suggest the proposer add additional and organized breakdowns about the team and their experiences, how the money will be used to bring the product to market,  and the roadmap. Additionally, I recommend the proposer communicate what insight they have for how likely the success of the project will be based on their previous builds. For example, I assume based on the development they claim to have completed, that they have had some successes in building out wallet connected gaming apps? I would suggest they share some of the code written, links to any games or 3D apps they have built, etc.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer does not indicate how they will provide progress updates if funded. In this section voters want to see how the proposer, if funded, will communicate progress and judicial use of awarded funds. It is important for awarded proposers to be held accountable for their end of the bargain. In this case it is to bring Cardano gaming tools to the community to encourage more gaming builds on Cardano.  I would recommend the proposer spend some time laying out an approach to providing updates. Many past proposers have done it in the following ways, YouTube video updates, websites with product demos and code snippets, Github Commits, Project Catalyst weekly presentations, etc. In this section we want to see a clear roadmap with clear ways in which the team will communicate the status of the roadmap as time moves on to completion of project. The more detailed the better. For example, you might explain that end of Q1 post funding, you will have workable code that will be posted to GitHub, and that you will release a video giving votes and the community an update on progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
Upon considering this proposal, I could say that the target audience that this project aims towards is different from those that I’ve come across. Specifically, this one chooses to benefit the game developers rather than the usual crowd of gamers, which could prove fruitful since this group of target audience hasn’t exactly been receiving as much attention. The ultimate goal of the project is the gained benefits of Cardano by offering more functionality and operability, which is expected to bring in more users into the ecosystem. Another welcoming feature is the utilization of open source when the project is met with success, which shall enable the community to better observe the process of project formation. The proposal also poses a potential challenge in the foreseeable future as well, and addresses a viable resolution, though the specifics are yet to be seen.
Nonetheless, I certainly feel that the proposal could hint at more details of the project, since I find what is offered on the table lacking the necessary to fascinate readers. 
To be specific, for better captivation of the target audience, I advise that the proposer add the information regarding how this tool functions, how it should ease the process of developing 3D content and what edges it has over the competition’s platforms (given that there are any to mention). On the other hand, in order to intrigue the investors to fund this project, this proposal should include core metrics or KPIs (in figures if possible) depicting its early success or perhaps how Cardano would generate earnings from the project.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is the section where I find content to be hardly sufficient and acceptable. From my understanding, a rather vague period of time to finish the project and the number of people involved in this project (supposedly that comma is a typo) are the only particulars provided. 
Other than those, listed in presented order, the key statistics missing from inclusion are a dedicated plan, timeline and milestones that this project hopes to achieve; a requested budget figure and its down-to-detail breakdown; and the enclosed information of participating members including background, expertise and affiliated links for more elaborate verification. I urgently advise that the proposer cover those said data in their next project presentation. Unfortunately, this undoubtedly leaves me in little favor to give a good rating.
f6_assessments.q2: This is also another section that causes the proposal to suffer tremendously from the lack of information, yet again. What is given in the development progress tracking section is barely justifiable, let alone the envisioned success section. Once again, I strongly recommend the appearance of extremely detailed information should the proposer wish for a high rate of funding approval

f6_assessments.q0:
The Impact part is quite brief, the functions of the project are not described much for the reader to understand clearly. The detail descriptions of how the project "The react component library tool" works and examples should be included.
The author also mentioned that proposal's development is linked to the development of their 3D-game, however, the 3D game has not been described much in the project. The results of the project as well as the 3D game, have not been described so it's hard for the readers to easily assess the impact.
The risks are mentioned, but the proposal's solutions are a bit difficult for me to imagine. Solutions by developing and adjusting it at a later stage need further analysis.
f6_assessments.q1:
The feasibility part is quite sketchy, it is difficult for the community to assess the feasibility of the project, the author has not provided the total necessary budget for the project as well as a specific plan for the solution. The roadmap section needs to be broken down into sections with specific completion dates.
Information about members Web developers and 3D-artist also does not have basic information of members such as: name, work experience, outstanding achievements, attached profiles for reference.
f6_assessments.q2:
This project does not have the complete information needed for the community to monitor and evaluate the progress of the project. Consists of:
The way to measure the progress and project development of the project is very general, the author needs to add quantitative indicators, KPIs for the completed work volume with specific timelines. Project tracking tools and methods also need to be added.
The criteria to determine the success of the project have not really been shown, in my opinion, the tool will be available open-source is not a good criterion to evaluate whether the project has achieved the goal or not.
It should be clear and quantitative indicators so that the community can rely on them to evaluate more easily.

f6_assessments.q0: In my opinion, i find this proposal totally aligns with this challenge since it aims to build a tool to enable game developer to easily build wallet integrated 3D-environments. However, the proposer has not addressed thoroughly how the tool is going to help our game developers. It’s better to give some examples of a similar tool (if there is any) or describe more details of how the tools work/ its impacts or how it’s going to help solving this problem. How is it going to bring Cardano forward as a whole, giving it more functionality and operability, attracting new players and therefore more users? Such questions are not having any answers here. If the proposer already has some work in progress, it should be good to provide some information of it as well. That way, we can have a better idea of this project. Since the idea is vaguely described, the team has also not had any proper suggestions to solve the foreseeable solutions that they address. To me, there are still a lot of information that needed to be added in to make it a more convinced idea.
f6_assessments.q1: In term of feasibility, there is no road map or timelines provided. Team members are briefly introduced, so we barely have any idea of their skills or experience to find out that if it’s suitable for the project. The budget breakdown hasn’t been done properly. For a short project, it’s good to have a budget breakdown based on hourly work of the team. With very little information being given, it’s almost impossible to justify the requested amount of this project.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal also lacks of a key metrics. I don’t know how the auditor can audit the project without any key metrics or milestones. There is absolutely nothing to rely on to define the success of this project. I think the success of a tool is determined by how adaptable it is on the ecosystem, how welcome it is to developer and how effectively it works. So I strongly suggest the team to carry on working on building a set of key metrics on those similar aspect to help the community with it. Otherwise, I only find that this proposal is a very basic draft of a proper proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: In the proposal, I can see that the writer has briefly introduce the project as well as the audience that they aim for. Cardano system was also mentioned in the proposal. However, it seems hard for me to tell if their proposed solution could address the challenge or not because the content was short and not clear, so I found it difficult to check if their project had anything aligned with the challenge’s key metrics or not. About the possible risks, they have foreseen the problem and also have thought about how to solve it generally. So for this part, they should have written more clearly about the proposed solution.
f6_assessments.q1: Overall, they couldn’t give detailed plan and timeline, and detailed budget breakdown either, which I think they need to focus on more and add more information for people to be able to understand what their project is going to generate. This shows that they might have not completing their plan, not well preparing for each task or each step in the journey. They have mentioned that they would have web developers and 3D artists working closely together. However, as I have said, there still needed to be more information about this aspect so that readers can have a clear vision of their project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal was still lack of information about how the team would measure the progress of their project. They just said that they would track the process in accordance with the development of the 3D game but it is difficult for readers to really know what they were going to do and what achievements they were going to make at which stage. It is also hard to know what the success look like to them because they didn’t mention it clearly. They need to write the proposal more thoroughly next time.

f6_assessments.q0:
Now this is a proposal about web tool development to help game developers integrate their 3D game using react, Three.js.
We do not see many tools geared towards 3d on-chained game development and this will be a great addition for cardano game developers if executed to success.
I also like the fact that the proposal is aware of the fact that a migration away from react is a potential problem especially with the exponential growth and use of flutter.
I am giving 5 star for impact.

Due to the lack of a team or any links , i will be giving this 2 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like a good idea to help games that need wallet functions operate.  As a side note I hope that it does not encourage a rash of games that expect the user to send things into them and hold them there, as that is a bad idea.  User items should remain in their own wallet as much as possible, but integrated wallets in a game could help new people who don't have their own wallets, and it could also help games store and distribute game tokens.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer refers to "we" and claims that they have been working on a game for some time now.  There is no evidence of anything linked or included in this proposal whatsoever to establish anything about what the project is.  There is no information about the team currently working, what they've accomplished in the past, or who they are.  Developer needs to include some more detailed information on who is working on what and what projects they've worked on in the past, if any.  Links to social media or project websites are very helpful.
f6_assessments.q2: Information is extremely lacking.  Developer does provide a timeline that there will be a solution within 2-4 months after funding, however there is very little information here to go on as nothing specific is mentioned other than vague references to an unsubstantiated "3D-game."  Developer should provide as much information as possible including some examples of what the game will look like and why it is a good investment.

solution: We aim to develop a react component library tool to enable game developer to easily build wallet integrated 3D-environments (open source).
experience: We are working with 3D-applications (desktop- and web-based) for quite some time now. Currently we're developing a smart-contract based game that includes a responsive 3D-environment and comprehensive Cardano wallet integration.
